enchantment.combat_reborn.cleaving.desc: Increases both damage dealt and the duration for which shields are disabled
enchantment.combat_reborn.parry.desc: Reduces the shield strength penalty on a successful parry, and adds a chance for successful parries to block crushing blows
enchantment.combat_reborn.stagger.desc: Parrying an attack damages and applies both weakness and slowness to the attacker
enchantment.combat_reborn.dueling.desc: Increases shield strength recovery provided when attacking
text.autoconfig.combat_reborn/general.op: Whether custom attribute values should be used for many vanilla and modded weapons. These can be configured in config/combat_reborn/weapons.json5
Whether custom attribute values should be used for many vanilla and modded armor pieces. These can be configured in config/combat_reborn/armor.json5
Whether the Shield overhaul should be enabled, which includes new mechanics such as parrying and a strength meter. Also includes 5 new enchantments - Parry, Endurance, Stagger, Dueling & Cleaving
Whether the Shield Strength overlay should be rendered as a hotbar or crosshair element
Whether Shields should display tooltips for their new attributes
The time, in game ticks, before a Shield is considered to be blocking attacks. Defaults to 0 for an instant response, with a maximum of 5 (identical to vanilla)
Whether Combat Reborn's reworked saturation, hunger and exhaustion systems should be used
Whether Combat Reborn's rebalanced armor systems should be active
What toughness system should be used. Can be DURABILITY-based, DAMAGE-based or NONE
Whether toughness should be displayed on the armor bar
A basic multiplier to be applied to toughness internally
Whether toughness should be displayed on the armor bar
The amount of defense / toughness points required to hit the middle percentage
The percentage of damage to be reduced when the middle points are reached (0-100)
The amount of defense / toughness points required to hit the max percentage
The percentage of damage to be reduced when the max points are reached (0-100)
The gradient to be used when calculating damage reduction relative to defense / toughness points. A lower gradient biases lower values, and a higher gradient biases higher values (0-2)
A basic multiplier to modify the amount of defense / toughness used in the damage formula
The multiplier applied to the effectiveness of damage reduction provided by enchantments
The maximum percentage of damage reduction that can be provided by enchantments. 80% is equivalent to vanilla (0-100)
Whether soups & stews should stack to 16
Whether taking damage from another entity should cancel the consumption of an item
Whether snowballs and eggs should inflict knockback
Whether Enderscape's Rubble Shields should have custom balancing
